ovdesc.p: This screen is used to setup parameters for calculation of Exposure Date, in a manner which can be processed by the payments hub using peeling logic. Exposure date is the date from which credited funds are available for use by the client. Banks process certain transactions wherein, even though funds are credited to the client immediately, client cannot make use of those funds.

Example: A cheque is presented for collection by the payee. The bank knows that cheque clearing will take 2 days. In this case, the bank can credit the funds to the payee with an exposure date set as 2 days in future.
Even though the amount is credited to the account, the payee or the client cannot be withdraw the funds before the exposure date.
A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or delete a record in store table, PPT.EXPOSUREDATE.

desc.p: Specifies the Product code as defined within Product determination. This could only be a valid & unique ClientConditionsProductCode as per static data HeavyweightProductCond or LightWeightProductCond table.
If left blank, a default value of "*" is set.

The value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the Order (sequence) of the records.
In this table order matters and as soon the first match is found that value will be picked up. Ranking would be required to maintain that order.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.

This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.

Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Specifies the offset mentioned in number of days which needs to be subtracted or added to the exposure date base to arrive at the actual exposure date.
